ThingDef.label: Iron powder
ThingDef.description: Crushed ore powder. Used for the production of alloys.

ThingDef.label: Nickel powder
ThingDef.description: Crushed ore powder. Used for the production of alloys.

ThingDef.label: Copper powder
ThingDef.description: Crushed ore powder. Used for the production of alloys.

ThingDef.label: Tin powder
ThingDef.description: Crushed ore powder. Used for the production of alloys.

ThingDef.label: Aluminum powder
ThingDef.description: Crushed ore powder. Used for the production of alloys.

ThingDef.label: Titanium powder
ThingDef.description: Crushed ore powder. Used for the production of alloys.

ThingDef.label: Lead powder
ThingDef.description: Crushed ore powder. Used for the production of alloys.

ThingDef.label: Gold powder
ThingDef.description: Crushed ore powder. Used for the production of alloys.

ThingDef.label: Silver powder
ThingDef.description: Crushed ore powder. Used for the production of alloys.

ThingDef.label: Zinc powder
ThingDef.description: Crushed ore powder. Used for the production of alloys.

ThingDef.label: Blister copper alloy
ThingDef.description: An ingot of metal with good electrical conductivity. This copper alloy is quite primitive and cannot be used for sophisticated industry.

ThingDef.label: Pure copper alloy
ThingDef.description: An ingot of metal with good electrical conductivity. Aluminum is used in electrical engineering and to create working tools, although its scope is quite extensive.

ThingDef.label: Tin alloy
ThingDef.description: Low-melting metal ingot. Tin is often used as a binder in alloys.

ThingDef.label: Aluminium alloy
ThingDef.description: A metal ingot with good electrical conductivity. Aluminum is used in electrical engineering and to create working tools, although the scope of its application is quite extensive.

ThingDef.label: Titanium alloy
ThingDef.description: Strong metal ingot. Titanium has high strength and resilience, making it an excellent material when reliability is required.

ThingDef.label: Lead alloy
ThingDef.description: Toxic heavy metal ingot. It is often used in the manufacture of weapons and ammunition.

ThingDef.label: Brass alloy
ThingDef.description: Multicomponent metal ingot. It is used in the creation of blanks in the foundry industry.

ThingDef.label: Gold alloy
ThingDef.description: Precious metal ingot. People will never stop craving for it.

ThingDef.label: Silver alloy
ThingDef.description: Precious metal ingot. It is used as a side component in alloys. It is an important part of trading.

ThingDef.label: Bronze alloy
ThingDef.description: Ingot of metal. It is used as an alternative to steel, with greater ductility.

ThingDef.label: Simple plates
ThingDef.description: Plates made from alloys with a fairly low strength.

ThingDef.label: Strong plates
ThingDef.description: Plates made from alloys with a fairly low strength.

ThingDef.label: Super strong plates
ThingDef.description: Plates made from alloys with a fairly low strength.

ThingDef.label: Sand
ThingDef.description: Fine powder from rocks. Can be melted into glass or applied in industry.

ThingDef.label: Clay
ThingDef.description: Fine-grained sedimentary rock, elastic when wet. It is used in the creation of vessels and blanks.

ThingDef.label: Slag
ThingDef.description: Large fragments of rocks of various shapes.

ThingDef.label: Dirt
ThingDef.description: The standard soil for most temperature zones on the planet.

ThingDef.label: Wood planks
ThingDef.description: Wood processed into boards. Used in the production of various mechanisms and parts.

ThingDef.label: Caoutchouc
ThingDef.description: Caoutchouc used in the production of industrial materials.

ThingDef.label: Glass
ThingDef.description: Heat treated sand converted to glass forms.

ThingDef.label: Oil
ThingDef.description: A flammable liquid widely used in the chemical industry and as a primitive chemical fuel.

ThingDef.label: Greek fire
ThingDef.description: Extremely dangerous fuel, widespread on Earth.

ThingDef.label: Combustible mixture
ThingDef.description: Extremely dangerous fuel.

ThingDef.label: Gunpowder
ThingDef.description: Explosive gunpowder suitable for use in weaponry.

ThingDef.label: Smokeless gunpowder
ThingDef.description: Explosive gunpowder suitable for use in weaponry.

ThingDef.label: Sugar
ThingDef.description: Sweetish white powder.

ThingDef.label: linen cloth
ThingDef.description: Cloth woven from organic linen fibers.

ThingDef.label: Paper
ThingDef.description: Relatively durable wood fiber paper. Most often from cane.

ThingDef.label: Yellorium alloy
ThingDef.description: An ingot of living metal obtained by bio-processing with arachnids. The metallic properties, however, are very weakly expressed. Can only be produced in a processing hive.

ThingDef.label: Silkworm
ThingDef.description: An unusual insect used to produce the finest silk.

ThingDef.label: silk
ThingDef.description: Soft and gentle to the body fabric, clothes from which all the rich and nobles want to get.

ThingDef.label: Concrete
ThingDef.description: Building material obtained by mixing cement and water. It is used for the construction of very durable structures.

ThingDef.label: Sulphuric acid
ThingDef.description: Heavy oily liquid, colorless and odorless, with a strongly acidic "copper" taste. It is a very strong acid.

ThingDef.label: Hydrochloric acid
ThingDef.description: Colorless, transparent, caustic liquid, "smoking" in air. Strong acid.

ThingDef.label: Boric acid
ThingDef.description: Colorless crystalline substance in the form of flakes, odorless. Weak acid.
